text: Urko Vera Mateos (; born 14 May 1987) is a Spanish professional footballer who plays for CD Guijuelo as a centre forward. ==Club career== Born in Barakaldo, Biscay, Vera played mostly amateur football until the age of 23, having represented Basque giants Athletic Bilbao as a youth from ages 10–12. During his spell at SD Lemona, he received part of his wage by taking the team's kits to the laundry.Urko Vera, de mileurista al cielo (Urko Vera, from mileurista to the sky); El Mundo, 16 March 2011 (in Spanish) In the last minutes of the 2011 January transfer window, after impressing with Lemona in Segunda División B (the club was coached by legendary Athletic player Aitor Larrazábal), Vera was acquired by the Lions, signing a one 1/2-year contract and initially being assigned to the reserve side, Bilbao Athletic.Urko Vera ficha por el Athletic hasta 2012 (Urko Vera signs with Athletic until 2012); Canal Athletic, 26 January 2011 (in Spanish) He made his first-team – and La Liga – debut on 5 February, coming on as a substitute for Iker Muniain for the final 15 minutes of a 3–0 home win against Sporting de Gijón.Easy for Bilbao; ESPN Soccernet, 5 February 2011 On 14 March 2011, again appearing from the bench, Vera scored his first goal for Athletic Bilbao, heading home in injury time in a 2–2 draw at Getafe CF.Vera rescues point for Bilbao; ESPN Soccernet, 14 March 2011 After being released he resumed his career in Segunda División, representing five clubs in just four years, including CD MirandésEl Mirandés ficha a Urko Vera y Aitor Fernández (Mirandés sign Urko Vera and Aitor Fernández); Mundo Deportivo, 13 August 2014 (in Spanish) for which he netted 20 times in all competitions.Un triplete de Urko Vera mete al Mirandés en la tercera fase (Three from Urko Vera send Mirandés to third stage); Diario AS, 10 September 2014 (in Spanish)Los goles de la Liga Adelante tienen pasaporte español (Liga Adelante goals have a Spanish passport); La Liga, 9 June 2015 (in Spanish) Vera moved to Jeonbuk Hyundai Motors FC in the K League 1 in late July 2015.루이스-우르코 베라,'전북의 새 외국인 선수' (Luiz Henrique-Urko Vera, 'Jeonbuk Hyundai's new foreign players'); Osen, 26 July 2015 (in Korean) On 10 January of the following year, he returned to his country and joined CA Osasuna in the second level.Urko Vera y Manuel, nuevos jugadores de Osasuna (Urko Vera and Manuel, new players of Osasuna); CA Osasuna, 10 January 2016 (in Spanish) On 19 August 2016, Vera signed a one-year deal with SD Huesca, still in the second tier.Urko Vera llega a la SD Huesca (Urko Vera arrives at SD Huesca); SD Huesca, 19 August 2016 (in Spanish) The following 23 January, he returned to Mirandés after leaving by mutual consent.Urko Vera, nuevo jugador del Club Deportivo Mirandés (Urko Vera, new player of Club Deportivo Mirandés); CD Mirandés, 23 January 2017 (in Spanish) On 18 May 2017, Vera moved to Romania with CFR Cluj. In January 2019, after a short loan spell at FC Astra Giurgiu also in the country's Liga I, he signed with English League Two club Oldham Athletic. His contract at the latter was mutually terminated on 24 January 2020, and he returned to the Spanish lower leagues shortly after with CD Guijuelo. ==Honours== Eibar *Segunda División: 2013–14 Jeonbuk Hyundai *K League 1: 2015 CFR Cluj *Liga I: 2017–18, 2018–19 *Supercupa României: 2018 ==Notes== ==References== ==External links== * * * * * * Category:1987 births Category:Living people Category:Sportspeople from Barakaldo Category:Spanish footballers Category:Basque footballers Category:Association football forwards Category:La Liga players Category:Segunda División players Category:Segunda División B players Category:Tercera División players Category:CD Laudio players Category:SD Eibar footballers Category:SD Lemona footballers Category:Bilbao Athletic footballers Category:Athletic Bilbao footballers Category:Hércules CF players Category:SD Ponferradina players Category:AD Alcorcón footballers Category:CD Mirandés footballers Category:CA Osasuna players Category:SD Huesca footballers Category:CD Guijuelo footballers Category:K League 1 players Category:Jeonbuk Hyundai Motors FC players Category:Liga I players Category:CFR Cluj players Category:FC Astra Giurgiu players Category:English Football League players Category:Oldham Athletic A.F.C. players Category:Spanish expatriate footballers Category:Expatriate footballers in South Korea Category:Expatriate footballers in Romania Category:Expatriate footballers in England Category:Spanish expatriate sportspeople in South Korea Category:Spanish expatriate sportspeople in Romania Category:Spanish expatriate sportspeople in England
title: Urko Vera
